result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith Evan Miller Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: CONCURRENT with any other sentence.
Court ordered the defendant's driver's license revoked for 6 MONTHS.

miscConds.notes: Full-time work/school (minimum of 30 hours of work per week if in school).

Obtain a valid driver's license.
Complete 8 hours of in person driver's education. 
Write a 5 paged (typed, double-spaced) essay about the dangers of fleeing the police and reckless driving.
No driving without a valid driver's license.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of the probation period. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

timeConds.notes: STAYED until 6-01-2023. Court permanently stays the condition time if the defendant has completed the essay, 8 hours of in person driver's education, and has a valid driver's license by 6-01-2023.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: CONCURRENT with any other sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith Evan Miller Jr

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Keith Evan Miller Jr in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Keith Evan Miller Jr.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS, CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  Court ordered the defendant's driver's license revoked for 6 MONTHS. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS, CONCURRENT to any other sentence, with credit for 8 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. 

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: 
The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED: 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Full-time work/school (minimum of 30 hours of work per week if in school).
- Complete 50 hours of community service.  
- Obtain a valid driver's license. 
- Complete 8 hours of in person driver's education. 
- No driving without a valid driver's license. 
- Write a 5 paged (typed, double-spaced) essay about the dangers of fleeing the police and reckless driving. 

- AS TO COUNT 1, 9 MONTHS of condition time at the House of Correction, STAYED until 6-01-2023. Court permanently stays the condition time if the defendant has completed the essay, 8 hours of in person driver's education, and has a valid driver's license by 6-01-2023.

Court ordered the defendant to pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of the probation period. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Driver's Safety Course Certificate.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Supervision Report 10-13-2022

Defendant Keith Evan Miller in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a plea hearing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Keith Evan Miller in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keith Evan Miller in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Due to reasons stated on the record, defense requested a status conference. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-10-22

Defendant Keith Evan Miller in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 20CF829. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Parks. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report 2-28-22

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  
No driving without a valid license.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keith Evan Miller in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Keith Evan Miller in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keith Evan Miller appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
